bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to W.H. Hoffmann, January 20, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg sends Hoffmann reprints of the painting, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to W.H. Hoffmann, January 20, 1942
div1.opener:
January 20, 1942
Prof. W. H. Hoffmann, M.D.
Director of The Finlay Institute
Cerro 1381
Habana, Cuba
Dear Dr. Hoffmann
div1.p:
As I told you in my letter of December
15, we were having a new run of the insert carrying the
picture “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” which ran in the
JOURNAL of the AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSOCIATION. This is
now off the press and I am sending two hundred (200)
copies for you in care of our distributors in Cuba,
Bestov Products. Our Mr. Federico Gomez will deliver
them to you personally. Our reason for shipping them
to Bestov is that we feel that they will go through the
customs more rapidly.

I am much interested in your letter of
January 15 and hope that the pictures which we are send-
ing may be of value to you in your work.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, George A: Kellogg GAK:L
copy to Dr. P.S. Hench
